page.title: 14CATTLE FARMING
page.content: Most of the grassland west of Congleton Edge is used for pasture and grazing.Where the land started to rise it became rocky and rougher.All the fields are fenced off and hedged sometimes with trees and bushes as well.Most of the area west of the old railway is still used for silage.In another field there was a large herd of cows.The rest of the fields are mostly covered with woodland and rough grassland.Nearly all the fields are bordered with a fence.This maybe because of poor access to the area.Behind this is a row of trees which acts as a hedge.Nearer Astbury the fieids are mainly for grazing and pasture,with many herds of cows in them.All these fields are very well looked after and have very good hedge boundries.
